title: second year
content: do you get promoted if you have exactly 24 credits of backlogs?

comments.body: If I'm not wrong it was 22 in this year's backlog circular.I somewhere read on this sub too, it's 22.Confirm with others once.
You cannot have more than 22 credits backlog in order to pass to the next year
Confirm with the COE directly u/Wrong_Arrival_6875. Why are you requesting information about your passing criteria from the subreddit?
bruv the coe dont reply man
Then go visit in person. If it's something as important as graduating to the next year, you should visit and sort out these things.

i asked the coe 

he said anything above 24 is not passing to the next year

its still 24
